title: Sample, late 18th century
medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk embroidery on silk foundation with metal sequins, bullion and brilliants
Technique: embroidered in satin, stem, couching, and knot stitches on supplementary warp pile (velvet), cut and voided
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Brown cut and voided velvet with a small scale geometric pattern, embroidered with metallic gold thread, gold metal sequins, bullion and white and yellow silk floss in a large floral pattern in the style of Jean Francois Bony.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sample, late 18th century.
late 18th century. Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk embroidery on silk foundation with metal sequins, bullion and brilliants
Technique: embroidered in satin, stem, couching, and knot stitches on supplementary warp pile (velvet), cut and voided. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-52-29.
